text:
Who would be impacted the most by the GOP “health care” plan?
✓Women
✓People with disabilities 
✓People living in poverty
✓Elderly
✓Children
We do not need to throw 22 million off health insurance. We need Medicare-for-all, and I will introduce that as soon as this debate is over.
Let's not forget that Sen. McConnell still refuses to hold one hearing on the health care bill that would throw 22 million off insurance.
In the short-term, to improve the Affordable Care Act, we should have a public option in 50 states and lower the Medicare age to 55.
We may disagree on where to go with health care, but there should at least be open debate. Not just decisions made behind closed doors.
Voting is your right — one that needs to be protected and strengthened throughout the entire country.
We also need to finally update and reinvigorate the Voting Rights Act, which was gutted by the Supreme Court in 2013.
That means legislation to strengthen protections against discriminatory laws, modernize voter systems, and expand early voting.
As Trump attempts to restrict voting rights, we have to work to make it *easier* for everyone to vote.
In need of a playlist for a bbq tomorrow? I’ve got you covered. https://open.spotify.com/user/senatorkamalaharris/playlist/447DQxPqltGdQq5WqhzIZ5

The Senate @GOP is brazenly giving tax cuts to the wealthiest, while gutting Medicaid.

Nearly 1 in 5 Americans count on Medicaid.
Today marks six months since I was sworn in as Senator for the great state of California. Humbled and honored every single day to serve you.
Today, I’m featuring the beautiful San Gabriel Mountains National Monument. A rare place to get away in Los Angeles, it must be protected. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DD05gRiWsAEwEO7.jpg
Starting today, I’ll be highlighting California’s 6 National Monuments that are under threat by the Trump Administration in my cover photos.
